div.div: ὀιστός (οἴσω, φέρω): arrow. Made of wood, or a reed, with barbed metal point, the lower end feathered and notched (γλυφίδες), or with projections, enabling the fingers to take a firm hold on the arrow in drawing. Poisoned arrows are mentioned only exceptionally, Od. 1.261, Il. 4.213.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
